greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest common divisor of n! and n^n.
comment: a(n) also equals the smallest positive integer such that lcm(a(1), a(2), a(3), ... a(n)) = n!, for every positive integer n. - _Leroy Quet_, Apr 28 2007
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
formula: a(n) = Product_{p|n} p^(sum{k >= 1} floor(n/p^k)), where the product runs over the distinct primes p that divide n. - _Leroy Quet_, Apr 28 2007
a(n) = (numerator of B(n, 1/n))/n^(n - 1), where B(.,.) is the Euler beta function. - _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Nov 22 2017
a(p) = p for p prime. - _Peter Luschny_, Nov 29 2017
results.author: _Leroy Quet_
ext: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Dec 08 1999
